channel.title: Sharesource.org
channel.description:
[quote="Moparisthebest"]Yes, I have already heard about it, you can make a thread about it if you want.[/quote] No, this is not another, "i am here to advertise my forum to steal all your traffic" post, because what i am advertising is not a forum/community. It is the site and the IRC server (irc.sharesource.org) Well, TimGroe is setting up a site called [url=http://www.sharesource.org]ShareSource[/url], and in my opinion it is a great idea, well prepared site and seeing as this community is always babling on about "community" projects, then this could help kick one of these "community projects" off because its a great way to share the work on your development easy. So if you are planning on some type of project that you need to share your files with other members of your team, why not start now by [url=http://sharesource.org/register/]Registering?[/url] then [url=http://sharesource.org/newproject/]Add your project[/url]. Reasons to join and use sharesource: [ul][li]Reason 1 - ShareSource is FREE![/li] [li]Reason 2 - ShareSource adds a new feature every month![/li] [li]Reason 3 - ShareSource exports XML and RSS in most places.[/li] [li]Reason 4 - ShareSource can manage all your projects[/li] [li]Reason 5 - ShareSource is an easy to use website, in simple to understand language[/li] [li]Reason 6 - ShareSource has its very own IRC server, that can be used for General talk, Site discussions, or make your own channel to talk with your development team about your project![/li][/ul] [b][u]How to join the IRC server?[/u][/b] Basically if you don't already have an IRC client then download google, "Free IRC clients" or use one of these links i give you: [url=http://xchat.org/download/]Xchat[/url] [url=http://mirc.com/get.html]mIRC[/url] Once you have them open and running type in chat box at the bottom of the window the following.
/server irc.sharesource.org
/nick Whatevernickyouchoose
/ns register password email
/join #chat
/join #support
Any questions once on the IRC come into #support and someone will be gladly help you. [b]Stupidity is not tolerated, on the site or on the IRC[/b] Hope you decide to join! PS: Sorry if i have any spelling mistakes i rushed it a bit :P

item.title: Sharesource.org
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Yes, I have already heard about it, you can make a thread about it if you want.

No, this is not another, “i am here to advertise my forum to steal all your traffic” post, because what i am advertising is not a forum/community.
It is the site and the IRC server (irc.sharesource.org)

Well, TimGroe is setting up a site called ShareSource, and in my opinion it is a great idea, well prepared site and seeing as this community is always babling on about “community” projects, then this could help kick one of these “community projects” off because its a great way to share the work on your development easy.

So if you are planning on some type of project that you need to share your files with other members of your team, why not start now by Registering? then Add your project.

Reasons to join and use sharesource:

[ul][li]Reason 1 - ShareSource is FREE![/li]
[li]Reason 2 - ShareSource adds a new feature every month![/li]
[li]Reason 3 - ShareSource exports XML and RSS in most places.[/li]
[li]Reason 4 - ShareSource can manage all your projects[/li]
[li]Reason 5 - ShareSource is an easy to use website, in simple to understand language[/li]
[li]Reason 6 - ShareSource has its very own IRC server, that can be used for General talk, Site discussions, or make your own channel to talk with your development team about your project![/li][/ul]

How to join the IRC server?

Basically if you don’t already have an IRC client then download google, “Free IRC clients” or use one of these links i give you:
Xchat
mIRC

Once you have them open and running type in chat box at the bottom of the window the following.

/server irc.sharesource.org
/nick Whatevernickyouchoose
/ns register password email
/join #chat
/join #support

Any questions once on the IRC come into #support and someone will be gladly help you.
Stupidity is not tolerated, on the site or on the IRC

Hope you decide to join!

PS: Sorry if i have any spelling mistakes i rushed it a bit

Read full topic
